title: Mortality Model
description: The SN variant uses an SDI-based mortality model as described in Section 7.3.2 of Essential FVS: A User's Guide to the Forest Vegetation Simulator (Dixon 2002, referred to as EFVS).

methodology.reference: Section 7.3.2 of Essential FVS: A User's Guide to the Forest Vegetation Simulator (Dixon 2002)
steps: 1) determining the amount of stand mortality (section 7.3.2.1 of EFVS)
2) dispersing stand mortality to individual tree records (section 7.3.2.2 of EFVS)
methodology.below_threshold: summation of individual tree background mortality rates is used
methodology.above_threshold: stand level density-related mortality rates are used

background_mortality.description: Individual tree background mortality rates for all species

cycle_adjustment.description: Adjusted to the length of the cycle using compound interest formula

mortality_distribution.description: Mortality dispersed to individual tree records based on relative height

final_mortality.description: Final mortality rate adjusted by species-specific mortality modifier

variables.RI: proportion of the tree record attributed to mortality
variables.RIP: final mortality rate adjusted to the length of the cycle
variables.Y: length of the current projection cycle in years
variables.MR: proportion of the tree record attributed to mortality (bounded: 0.01 < MR < 1)
variables.PCTi: tree percentile in the distribution of stand basal area
variables.MORT: final mortality rate of the tree record

table_5_0_1.title: Coefficients used in the background mortality equation {5.0.1} in the SN variant
table_5_0_1.description: Species-specific coefficients p0 and p1 for background mortality calculation

table_5_0_2.title: MWT values for the mortality equation {5.0.4} in the SN variant
table_5_0_2.description: Species-specific mortality weight values representing shade tolerance

process_description.density_related_mortality: When stand density-related mortality is in effect, the total amount of stand mortality is determined based on the trajectory developed from the relationship between stand SDI and the maximum SDI for the stand. This is explained in section 7.3.2.1 of EFVS.
process_description.mortality_dispersion: Once the amount of stand mortality is determined based on either the summation of background mortality rates or density-related mortality rates, mortality is dispersed to individual tree records in relation to a tree's height relative to the average stand height (RELHT).
process_description.multiple_passes: The mortality model makes multiple passes through the tree records multiplying a record's trees-per-acre value times the final mortality rate (MORT), accumulating the results, and reducing the trees-per-acre representation until the desired mortality level has been reached.
process_description.basal_area_maximum: If the stand still exceeds the basal area maximum sustainable on the site the mortality rates are proportionally adjusted to reduce the stand to the specified basal area maximum.
